Description of the non-conformity: Drainage holes are not protected as per drawing requirements. This statement follows several Quality Notification received from Airbus.  Affected part list can be found in attached declarative documents.  Action to be performed: Inspect suspect area (drain holes) and protection scheme has to be applied for every Aircraft. Maintainability has been checked and is available in declarative documents.  TTR will be launched for the A/C in service and therefore no Concessions will be raised.  Industrial Limitation: NONE Apply protection scheme for all Aircraft within 2 years after first flight (recommended period).

Pre-TTR meeting held on 05/05/16. . ICB CONCLUSION : TTR - Yes (Ref. Available); Sorry available (Sa-16.111) I - Installed in SNZ A - RCA to be provided from supplier A - To be checked if other parts could be impacted. I - MSN36 & 49 to be checked urgently A - Assessment meeting to be organized immediately as we had already an occurrence in service.

AAAAA/BB/RT/15-00011  : Lack of FINCH fuel vapor barrier product on fasteners ASNA2042H  MoM of meeting 5/120/2002  TTR scope AAAAA to 41 MSN 23 to 33 not reworked MSN34 to 41 : already reworked in NZ but rework process not qualified by M & P  The rework of the MSN 24  is the priority 1 The NT rework  only is 80h/MSN + necessary access  from FAL .  Actions :  - Follow up  design office M & P for validation of the rework process : Jacques FOURNIE - to make a study on the remove/installation of the floors , mixer systems , tests : ME FAL - KEI asked a classification safety major : D. Meignen in TTR tool - A 2nd meeting will take place on Tuesday 6/10/15 to have more information from rework process validation : D. Meignen  2nd meeting on 06/10/2002  MoM of meeting 6/10/2002 10h-11h  Luc ANDRIVET ask for an official way forward validated by M & P Matthiew ORCHARD  No decision for TTR validation  3nd meeting on 8/10/2002  Decision to launch TTR Priority given to rework MSN24 further planning to be established by end of week 42 action taken by KES to get a official procedure validated from M & P to rework finch
ICB held on 20/06/2017. We agree to process by TTR preoccess

Bitte NC schließen. * ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * 14.10.2002 05:28 0120 INFA JACONBIAN (TH885W)  BSLAL1 494074372570 * Der Einkauf (Johanna Borkowski) wurde Infomiert * ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * 26.10.2002 07:37 0401 ATQ0 PETTENDRUP (TH40PM)  QSAM4 491757626969 * NC was created only for new part procurement. * Installation and check?s will be/was performed by WO. * No more further action by QS-Customization. *

Outcomes of the meeting & way forward: . - Normally until now no installation issues identified at St Eloi or FAL on the part. - One concession done for the APF box by the DO => Ref: PCT-005107734 (new PN V545 13767 000 01). - PN evolution from V545 13767 000 00 to V545 13767 000 01 due to Airbus request regarding the drillings which lead to FAI comparisons at ATI casting and identification of NC outer diameter on old PN. - Root cause analysis and corrective actions with supplier will be followed by the Event E-17.0453. - DO preliminary safety analysis is No safety / insignificant issue; no impact on A/C; no action on A/C required. - No need to put the NC parts into quarantine. . Main actions: . 1. Line Quality St. Eloi to confirm that no issue is / was encountered during assembly of the axe (spygo) and the bushing at St Eloi => Action Loic MOUNEY (DYBK) to check with people in charge=> Target 15 MAR 2017 . 2. Confirmation regarding safety analysis and action on A/C to be provided by MEMO => Action Aurelien PANTEL (ESYSKA) => Target 24 MAR 2017 . Next meeting:  Next TTR assessment meeting is planned for 24 MAR 2017 .

* << 13.02.2002 10:27 0001 ORI0 NAU, BJORK (NG12345)             >> * Found during incoming inspection: *  See attachments * * << 16.02.2002 08:27 0100 STE0 APELT, MATHEW (TH45C0) QSA2          >> * Steering. * << 17.02.2002 07:24 0101 DEC0 LINDECKE, RONNY (NG3171B) DASD4       >> * New Decision: RWK - Rework to drawing / Manufacturing Ass. performed * * Beschädigung nichtvertiefend ausgeschliffen nach AIPS03-03-001. >> * Ultrasonic thickness measurement and surface crack inspection (HF-EC) * performed in and around affected area, in accordance with AITM6-4016 and * AITM6-6003. * Equipment/Accessories: * EPOCH 600, Olympus, SN: 110147906 * Transducer: CLF-4, GE, SN: 0267L4 * Calibration Standard: Stepwedge 3.1354 (2024), Deharde, SN: L244 102348 * Probe: 2.835.01-2130, MP, SN: 6046 * Defectometer 2.837, Foerster, SN: 1284 * Calibration Standard: NFe 2.164-551, SN: 081H * Results: * Existing thickness: 0,95mm * Remaining thickness: 0,92mm * Cladding layer is not penetrated. * No crack indication detected. * * << 12.02.2002 08:14 0120 DEC0 LEEB, PETER (NG282C7) POSB4           >> * Stellungnahme RUAG: * Die Nacharbeit wurde von RUAG koordiniert und mit * Nacharbeitsauftrag 1570162 durch RUAG OSS Team durchgeführt. * Beschädigung nach AIPS03-03-001 auspoliert. * NDT Test koordiniert. * Kundensysteme abgeschlossen. * * << 23.02.2002 15:11 0500 ATQ0 APPLE, MATHEW (TH11C2) QSA2          >> * OK; no further action.
